body_html: The strides = [1, 2, 2, 1] are the strides for each of the dimension of the input tensor [batch, in_height, in_width, in_channels]. For the tf.nn.conv2d function the dimension 0 and 3 must have strides equal to 1. Based on what @Yangqing said in #196 I think the padding scheme is non-intuitive due to legacy reasons.

For the tf.nn.conv2d function the dimension 0 and 3 must have strides equal to 1. Based on what @Yangqing said in #196 I think the padding scheme is non-intuitive due to legacy reasons.
body: The strides = [1, 2, 2, 1] are the strides for each of the dimension of the input tensor [batch, in_height, in_width, in_channels]. For the tf.nn.conv2d function the dimension 0 and 3 must have strides equal to 1. Based on what @Yangqing said in #196 I think the padding scheme is non-intuitive due to legacy reasons.
